website_summaries.verdict: A top-selling blower that won't break your budget. Suitable for tackling small to mid-size jobs.
pros: An electrically powered blower with variable speeds
Can blow up to 110 miles per hour
Lightweight, easy to use, and powerful for its class
cons: Not ideal for large yards or huge piles of leaves

website_summaries.verdict: Corded leaf blower garners power from turbine fan technology and a Hyper-Stream nozzle.
pros: Forced air streams through turbine fan to get stronger air volume
Hyper-Stream nozzle channels air where you want it
On full power this blower will "knock your socks off," according to one user
cons: Not as much power as a gas mower
Debris cloggs air intake in the back of the unit

website_summaries.verdict: Reasonable price for a corded electric leaf blower with a 12-amp motor.
pros: Extremely powerful blower that should meet the needs of most people working with landscaping
Offers multiple speed controls, so you can find the right amount of power for each job
Has an airflow of up to 110 miles per hour and air movement of up to 600 cu
cons: A little heavier than some other corded models at 6.4 lbs

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Blower/Very Light Weight
customer_reviews.text: We use this for details at our car wash. It's very light weight/made really sturdy and can blow the water effortlessly off cars. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Tech Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Best Blower Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing blower!! I found this online after getting tired of having to constantly recharge the battery of a cordless Ego model that cost over $180. Upon reading about the 600CFM and seeing a YouTube video of a brick being blown across a smooth surface, I was sold on this particular Worx model. With a big yard, I do switch hands every now and then since my arms can get fatigued from handling the sheer power of this thing. Medium speed is plenty, but it's nice to have the higher setting for tougher jobs. Saving money with this PLUS a $20 Amazon Basics outdoor cable over the expensive cordless was the best decision ever made!
customer_reviews.author: Trent Macintosh

customer_reviews.title: It works well. My complaint is with Amazon. ...
customer_reviews.text: It works well. My complaint is with Amazon. This was clearly a returned item. The box was damaged, no packaging inside, instructions all crumpled. I couldn't send it back because once you fit the end bit on, it won't come off, so it wouldn't fit back in the box for return. So I've paid full price for a second hand item. Ad also didn't make it clear you need to buy an extension lead for it to work. Luckily, I had one, but am fed up with Amazin sending me stuff that others have returned. Not the first time it's happened!
customer_reviews.author: jacqueline stephen

customer_reviews.title: It Doesn't Work For Me
customer_reviews.text: I'd never bought a blower before. Like many people I was always annoyed when nearby neighbors cleaned up their yards. But this Fall with all the leaves it was my time. This blower was much larger than anticipated. While it is ideal for a very large area, for a mid-sized backyard it is overkill. It is also heavier than I expected. But my one star review is primarily due to the fact I couldn't get it to power up, even though I tried 2 known-true power ports. I theorize that this is due to either 1) I got a lemon, or 2) it requires a special power cord. So I have returned it to my nearby Kohl's store (easy peasy)
customer_reviews.author: Adam Smith

customer_reviews.title: powerful leaf blower
customer_reviews.text: It is very powerful and light weight. I am 76 years old and I can handle it with ease. I use it to blow under the refrigerator, stove, behind the piano the ceiling, the heating vents any heavy furniture i blow under and behind. Then I pick up the dust with the sweeper. I feel like my house is really clean when I am finished. I used it first in the house before my husband got a chance to use it in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Smith

customer_reviews.title: Air Volume Decreased After Trying the Gutter Cleaning Kit
customer_reviews.text: I received the leaf blower and immediately tried it out. I was so impressed with the air flow that I tossed out the box thinking I'm a satisfied customer. About a week later I attempted to use it with the Worx gutter cleaning attachment which I immediately did not like. However, once I detached the kit I then noticedthe leaf blower was no longer is capable of producing it's original impressive power. In other words, squeezing the flow though the gutter cleaner seemed to break it. Now it's just taking up space. I will stick to brand name products like my black and decker blower that I've had for years.
customer_reviews.author: JWest

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. I bought it less than a year ago and now it won't turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Velourfog

customer_reviews.title: What's the big deal?
customer_reviews.text: Everyone is giving rave reviews about this blower and I just don't see it... Worx compares it to a gas blower, not even close in my book - 3 stars for an unrealistic comparison. Pros, easy to grab, light weight - faster getting on the job - no maintenance required (or mixing fuel) Cons, No where near the speed/power of my 10yo gas blower, the back opening is good for sucking up anything flying around which clogs the air intake which requires shutting down to clean.
customer_reviews.author: BayotleTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Yes it's powerful. Yes it's easy to handle. NO it won't even last long enough to blow off my driveway before it over heats and the heat sensor kicks it off until it cools down. NO it doesn't work AT ALL sometimes. Some sort of loose connection inside I have to hit it with my fist sometimes to get it to turn on. Used it for 4 months. Now I had to go but another one. I purchased a Toro. 3 months into that one, really strong, works every time, does not shut off EVER.
customer_reviews.author: Boo Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Burned out and they shut down their customer service online chat!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this in the fall once or twice a week for leaves and a few times spring/ summer. Motor just burned out today. Went to website - online chat is their primary communication - it's disabled! Now you have to leave your number, and they will call you back... maybe today by 8pm...or tomorrow. WTH UPDATE 7/5 customer service called and they are replacing my unit free of charge- no need for me to send back or pay any shipping costs. In fact since my unit was backordered they are giving me the next level up product. Let's see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Constant Reader

customer_reviews.title: Light, powerful, durable blower!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this blower for the sole purpose of drying my car. It does it job fairly well. With a wax or sealant on my car it pretty much completely dries it. As far as it blowing leaves, I'm sure it would work just as well for a small yard if you have a big enough extension cord. This blower is powerful enough to dry off a car, that says a lot about how good it really is. Also it's extremely light and easy to carry. Also another good thing is it can be taken apart and stored in a fairly small box during seasons it's not being used. Overall good product, would reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, but difficult to use for long stretches of time.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is powerful enough to blow leaves and debris from grass. The only complaint is that the way you have to hold it, your arm will tire out very quickly. I wish it had a handle so you can steady it with your off hand to spread some of the strain. After a bit of use, I find myself either switching arms, or cradling the thing against my torso.
customer_reviews.author: comeng

customer_reviews.title: Big Wind
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a smaller electric leaf blower. It's a little bigger (but still easy to handle), but oh my does it pack a real punch! The amount of air it moves is truly amazing, due to its novel turbine design, and the variable speed control is a much needed bonus. My prior blower had only 2 speeds, while this one is completely variable. I find the variable speed feature more useful that I would have expected. It's build rugged, and has an built-in feature enabling the unit to be hung on a wall instead of simply laying around. That keeps my garage neater than before.
customer_reviews.author: Clarice

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Will Blow the Feathers off a Chicken
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a light weight but powerful blower to keep the flower beds, sidewalks, and porches clear of leaves, dirt, children, and cat fur. Used it for the first time today and it is amazing. This blower really can, well, uh.....blow! I have no idea where my gardening gloves blew to but I will search for them later. Well worth the money. And, lightweight so it does not get tiresome. Love the adjustable speeds (only discovered them after everything went flying off the porch).
customer_reviews.author: Velcro

customer_reviews.title: Had a problem real fast.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful and powerful product with an Achilles Heel. There is a mechanical shut off switch operated by the control that wants to stay shut off all the time, rendering the blower inoperative. I took the thing apart and removed the switch, which is really not needed. I also removed the mechanism that operates it. I now have a first class blower. This oversight must have cost the company millions. Great going! engineers.
customer_reviews.author: Terry M. Van Blaricom

customer_reviews.title: Most BANG for your BUCK!
customer_reviews.text: This product is insanely affordable and packs a punch. Give this item the chance. It has the ability to blow leaves over 15 feet and move volumes of debris. We used this on our 3/4 acre property lined with trees and I had the majority out at the front street within 1.5 hours. The main thing I liked about this product is the CFM. Compared to my dads gas powered 3X more expensive blower, this thing moves substantially more leaves than his. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Repman

customer_reviews.title: Works petty good with just one gripe.
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I've got with it is the same problem I've got with all corded power tools. It's the extension cord coming loose. They still haven't invented a device that will keep the power cord from pulling apart. Even tying the cords in a knot only works to some extent, it pulls loose and interrupts work. With that said, it's a good tool. Works as advertised. It has the correct blowing force for cleaning up leaves, any more it would be hard to handle and any less it wouln't do a good job. It's just about perfect.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Grider

customer_reviews.title: Bought two of them for cleaning. Good power
customer_reviews.text: Bought two these. Makes quick work of cleaning. For the price it was worth it. Wish they make another one bigger than this. The jet fan technology is better than the centrifugals blowers. I use it every time to dry the car. Takes about 5 minutes to finish the car. And gets the front grill, rims, and tail lights dry. Even great at drying the water off the floors. The weight is incredibly light which makes holding it for long periods easy. They really did their homework when designing this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Ar

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!  Lasted 4 uses before dying!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it while it worked. Got it Sept 29th 2018. Used it maybe 4x. Got it out to use yesterday and it died with an aroma of burning electric. Really? Not much for craftsmanship or quality are you WORX. This product had high ratings and I did alot of research before getting this. I liked the features, weight, strength, variable speed etc. But wow, clearly not designed to last at all!!! Contacting WORX support now. I'm sure that'll go great. I'm sure their "MAY be required to pay for shipping costs to us and for shipping of repaired/replaced product" will turn into MUST. DON'T BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: k karas

customer_reviews.title: Great value and performance
customer_reviews.text: I read another review before buying this saying its great but too heavy. This is far from true, in my opinion. I bought this to replace an old corded leaf blower that finally died. This is maybe 60% the weight of my old one, which wasn’t terribly heavy. I was actually surprised at how light it is. But it still feels durable and well built. This one is also easier to maneuver and blows harder. The thumb wheel speed controller is also very nice. All in all, assuming it holds up, this blower is well worth every penny, and more.
customer_reviews.author: SynePDX

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: ALL EXTENSION CORDS WILL NOT FIT!
customer_reviews.text: The WG520 is not overly powerful but sufficient in most uses. It’s balanced well, not to noisy, nor to heavy. HOWEVER, I have two extension cords and neither would plug right into the unit - it was such a tight fit I had to use Channel Locks to squeeze it together. This is why I one-starred it. UPDATE: Although I did not need another extension cord, I ordered a 16/3 50 footer just for this blower. To my amazement, this lighter duty cord ALSO would not plug in to the blower without considerable effort. The WG520 pigtail is of very poor design and to small to accommodate most extension cords!
customer_reviews.author: DepotsNutz

customer_reviews.title: This thing blows air
customer_reviews.text: Never tried any other brand, but it works as it advertised. The only thing to be aware is, you need an extension core with this. The plus came with the blower is really short and does not plug into a flat surface power plug (that means it won't go in wall plug either). I never knew about this but seems like a norm to my friends who is familiar with this. Anyhow, I can't seem to find any information about the requirement of an extension cord and just noticed all the pictures
customer_reviews.author: PoHao Su

customer_reviews.title: PICK YOUR SPEED!Skeptical
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I almost bought a different blower because I’d never seen one like this and was a little Skeptical spending money on a brand new product (@ least it’s new to me). It’s GREAT! I love it. Just by moving the dial you pick how strong you want it to blow, and NOT just 2 speeds. Wish I’d bought one before. I’ll never go back to the standard looking blowers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Shopped around but couldn’t see spending all the extra money for a battery cordless system. This leaf blower exceeds my needs for sure. Pros: -Weekly use and no maintenance required -lightweight system with comfortable usage -Good build quality -Very affordable Cons: -Do wish the plastic sleeve felt more rigid I’m afraid to hit it to hard or crack it -There is no flexible hose attachment from blower to funnel as in higher end models which would help swivel the funnel vs. moving your whole body/unit. However those options are on the Much higher end and gas powered machines. For the price and lightweight leaf blower this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Straight from NYC|AJ B

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I own a battery multitool that I happily use for work close to my house - quick easy use. I have gasoline blower that is messy and temperamental and I have abandoned. But if you want to move leaves this machine is powerful. I don't like being wired to an electric plug but this product is worth it. Its power moves leaves more quickly and easily than any blower I have ever had. I have tools for different purposes and few can do everything. If you have huge amounts of leavesand and acre +/- of land and you do not mind an electric cord this is an excellent tool.
customer_reviews.author: Playingpossum

customer_reviews.title: Great Leaf Mover
customer_reviews.text: This really moves air and leaves. I had a cheap ryobi backpack blower which quit so I decided to try one of these. It's not a backpack blower but for about 50 bucks I thought why not. The echo backpack blower I wanted was 400 bucks . Anyway for the money I think it's the best electric cord blower you could purchase. You do need a 12 guage cord with a maximum length of 150 feet. It must be hooked up to a 20 Amp outlet. I have two 20 amp outlets. Otherwise I could hear the difference. Once you hook this up correctly it really works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kroll

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, powerful with variable speed. WG520
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful blower. Looked like I was blowing the grass from its roots. I added 2 x 50 ft 12 guage outdoor cables and glad I did, it delivers the power this machine craves. Don't get the lighter and cheaper 16 guage cable. The variable speed is a must feature as it allows you to precisely create a nice pile of leaves. Looking forward to using this blower to clear my driveway of snow in the months to come. Trully excellent value with 3 years warranty. Will get one for my father in law for xmas.
customer_reviews.author: Mil

customer_reviews.title: Very powerfull but not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a very powerful unit but the power adjusting wheel does not do a very good job. It is heavy and not being able to get the correct speed makes the unit very difficult to control and use properly. It is very low or very high. Disappointed. The description states otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: DEMETRI

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Great leaf blower! Very powerful! The only thing I don’t like is the cord where you have to plug in the extension cord at, it’s round and plastic/rubber that protects it from water splashing onto it but it limits it from being able to be plugged in. You need a small extension cord that isn’t bulky on the end so it can be able to plug in. I just cut it with my knife so it can stretch and fit but that’s the only bad thing about it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: treston

customer_reviews.title: This one blows
customer_reviews.text: This thing blows! This is the most powerful electric blower I’ve used. I have an older Worx blower that also sucks stuff into a bag. The older one wasn’t very powerful and because of the large vacuum port, is cumbersome. I wanted a dedicated blower for cleaning off my riding mower, the garage, leaves, and light snowfall on the driveway. This one is pretty low profile, light, and powerful. It is so powerful it pushes itself back in your hand like a jet engine when on high. Variable speed is nice too.
customer_reviews.author: gate

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful machine. Was able to blow all tech leaves from a medium to large a size front and back yards with no issues. On the pro side, you can regulate airspeed, and. The power was more than enough to blow leaves in that where sitting on top of grass (pine needles needed the highest setting, and took some more effort). It is easy to manage, and the right length for me (5f11). It was very easy to assemble as well. It is not as light as others, but then again more powerful. After two hours of use, I only started to feel the weight towards the end with one had use for mostly the time.
customer_reviews.author: Erock

customer_reviews.title: Best electric blower out there...
customer_reviews.text: So yes this is loud and might be a little heavy for the smaller in stature, but if you want the best leaf blower for the money, I’d look no further. So far I’ve used this to clear leaves off the lawn, blow my grass clippings to my neighbors lawn two houses down and clear sawdust out of my garage/wood shop. Keep your loose shirt clear of the rear of the blower, grab it with two hands if you need to and get the job done. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Worx Great!
customer_reviews.text: 600 Cubic Feet per Minute..! Don't get caught up in that Mile Per Hour garbage, it's the CFM that matters. If you were to throttle the end of this blower with a smaller diameter orifice... the MPH/Velocity would be through the roof! but there would be LESS airflow... = less work. The blower is balanced in the hand, and feels natural. There is a built-in molded recess so you can conveniently hang the blower from a wall mounted screw if you so desire. Hope that helps... Oh yeah, I love this blower!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: Powerful. I can even move the leaves up an incline. Best used in a calm day. Blows leaves right into the woods, even if wet. Make sure you use a good cord which is rated correctly so you don't burn out the motor. I use a 12/3 50 foot cord. I wouldn't use anything less. Takes awhi!e to learn how to move them, keeping the leaves together. I think they have me an extra year on warranty for registering, the serial number on the blower. You need to take a picture of it on your cell so you can read it. But not bad to handle for people over 60. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: mike in mass

customer_reviews.title: This product BLOWs me away and it just WORXs
customer_reviews.text: Right after this was delivered to y house i opened the box, tossed the instructions to the side and assembled the extended plastic attachments. Once i connected power i was able to do about the same job in half the time. I was so excited to use the new blower. My older blower was louder, heavier and not very good at actually blowing. I am very impressed. As soon as i finished clearing up the front yard, i went into the back yard to try it on leaves on pea gravel...fantastic results. This makes yard work a little more fun....and save time, and no longer need ear protection. Now i just need to get rid of the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Godfather

customer_reviews.title: Amazing power
customer_reviews.text: The reviews didn't let me down and was the main reason as to why I purchased this. It's not heavy at all so it was weird that there was a review about it being difficult for that person to maneuver it with one hand. I'm 5'3" and 120lbs and had no issues, but then I have a 50lbs kid who always wants me to haul him around so maybe that's why it's not a big deal. Lightweight, good blowing power, affordable pricing. Perfect is you have a mid-size yard and need the extra help to pile everything up.
customer_reviews.author: galwonder818

customer_reviews.title: 2 prong plug!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a 1/2 acre yard with trees. It works well, even blows away the acorns. Pros: Powerful enough for leaves, acorns, etc. Not too loud. Better than gas blowers for noise, although you should always wear ear protection. Good price Fairly easy to manipulate, not too heavy. Cons NEEDS A 2-PRONG CORD, not the standard 3-prong that Amazon suggests you buy with it. Three prong cords are too big to fit in the little cup that houses the plug. A bit bigger than many, may be a challenge to store.
customer_reviews.author: Marji

customer_reviews.title: Melted itself after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Crapped out after 4 months of very occasional use. You get what you pay for I guess. Fill those warranty cards out, folks!
customer_reviews.author: Sara B

customer_reviews.title: The right one!
customer_reviews.text: I am a first time leaf blower shopper. I didn't know what I needed to consider in a leaf blower. I just knew that the air had to be forceful enough to reach leaves that were up to about 10' away from me. The leaves also get sticky and clump together so the blower had to be strong enough to take care of that, too. It also couldn't be too heavy because I had to hang onto it with one had to reach these awkward hard to reach spots! This one pretty much does the trick. It achieved 95% of what I needed for a difficult job.
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: It's a tornado machine
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Just wow. I just got done clearing the leaves off my entire front lawn in 10 minutes. It was no match for this bargain priced blower. I didn't even need to have it on full turbo power. No fuss, just took it out of the box, attached the pipe, plugged it into a cord and before I knew it I was done. I instantly fell in love with this thing. I hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Curt M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for. Lightweight, very powerful and easy to use. I've got about 150 feet of driveway surrounded by pine trees so mostly I'm just blowing away needles and the occasional pine cones. This thing works like a champ. Even damp leaf litter is easily cleared at half power. Personally I found it easiest to use by letting it hang fully from my arm and just using my wrist to aim, rather than trying to brace the entire blower. With it held at my side like that I didn't have any issue with clothing getting caught in the intake.
customer_reviews.author: emonk

customer_reviews.title: MPH vs CFM
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a long time user of corded blowers. The main benefits are less polluting and noise. With that said, I always had to give up on performance. Well, no more. This unit really does the job. I had been always caught up in MPH instead of the real value of CFM. I did not realize that to increase the MPH all the manufacturer has to do is decrease the blower nozzle size. I could not wait to get this unit since I had wet leaf pile that my old corded blower could not move. The new WORX turbine moved it rapidly and effectively. In fact, when I turned it on it almost started to fly. This unit works!
customer_reviews.author: Ski Master

customer_reviews.title: She works good, easy to handle and doesn't break
customer_reviews.text: I bought this corded model when it came time to replace my broken Toro model. I debated on getting a cordless but I don't want to have to mess with another battery and charger. I'll deal with the cord. This unit does a great job taking care of the blowing business and I like the variable speed. It's light enough and balanced well that it hangs on my garage wall on a big headed nail and doesn't stick out too much or want to get all sideways. Nothing but praises here for this WORX, it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Horse-N-Round

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Electric Blower!
customer_reviews.text: The strength of this blower is impressive. It moved wet leaves at our camp with ease. My wrist was a little strained at the end of my half hour session but was able to clear much more than i was previously able with a smaller blower. I anticipate that this blower will cut my efforts in half. Not very quiet but noise level is a fraction of the noise of a gas powered unit. So far, I’m impressed and would certainly recommend this blower to family. 4 stars on maneuverability due wrist fatigue at end of lengthy session. I’m looking into rigging-up a handle for two handed use.
customer_reviews.author: TJP

customer_reviews.title: Best Leaf Blower I've ever seen!
customer_reviews.text: This thing has more power to move even wet pine needles and leaves than anything I have ever seen. The weight is very well balanced in the handle, so very comfortable and maneuverable. I highly recommend this blower. I was really wanting to buy a battery powered blower, but worried about the blowing power and how long the battery would last. I'm perfectly fine with using an extension cord with this beauty. The variable speed is really good, so you can tone it down when you don't need so much power.
customer_reviews.author: B. Davis

customer_reviews.title: This thing BLOWS!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Black and Decker battery powered blower and it was good. It got the job done half of the time but then the other half left me with a dead battery. It also wasn't very powerful so jobs took longer to clean off. With this blower I can clear all of the dust, leaves and grass off of my patio along with any rock etc super fast! I haven't cut the yard yet but that's coming up this weekend. Very happy with this blower.
customer_reviews.author: TEXAS95

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed many leaf blowers & I went with this one! I am so HAPPY I did! I have a 3rd of an acre & used to rake for 6+ hrs. for just a section! Today I tried the WORX. I am over 65 & found it very easy to handle & lightweight! I managed to the whole area....flower beds...deck & driveway full of WET leaves! It blew them like they were feathers!!! One hour & 20 minutes to do it ALL!!! Thank you WORX for such a powerful machine!!!! I am a very happy & not exhausted lady here! This is well worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Loy

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite tools in the garage!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness is this thing powerful! I don't know why I've been dealing with the gas blowers for so long. Being tethered to the chord is a little nuisance but is all forgotten when you turn this thing on. At full throttle it is absolutely amazing and will tire your arm out from the air that it pushes. Having the variable speeds is fantastic for blowing out countertops and such in the garage. I love this leaf blower and is one of my favorite tools in the garage to use without a doubt!
customer_reviews.author: Butterzbean

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this leaf blower online after not being able to find one at the local stores. I have only used it to blow leaves for about 2 hours (my whole yard) and it worked great even blowing wet leaves with ease. Very satisfied so far - the variable speed control works well and doesn't blow mulch at the lower speed but does get rid of most leaves.
customer_reviews.author: DTBriz

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected!
customer_reviews.text: Having tired of gas-powered blowers and not wanting to spend the money of a battery-powered blower, I decided to purchase this WORX. I am impressed! No, it does not have the power of my dead gas blower(s), but it does a better than expected job of blowing out the garage and sweeping of the driveway and sidewalks. I use a blue winter extension cord because it is much more pliable and after a few times of getting use to a corded blower, I am sold on it.
customer_reviews.author: Moonshiner

customer_reviews.title: CFM is what counts not MPH
customer_reviews.text: Excellent blower. Great pushing power three time that of my last blower that was rated at 200 mph but only 200 cubic fee per minute. Its the Cubic Feet Per Minute that counts. The only draw back that is not really a draw back is when you turn this bad boy all the way to full power it will put a small strain on your arm to keep it in position. With all that power blowing out the nozzle it wants to move in the opposite direction and you have to hold it in place. A definite buy.
customer_reviews.author: ChevisN7

customer_reviews.title: SURPRISED!!!
customer_reviews.text: I did an online search and the WORX WG520 came up as a good value. I didn't want to spend much because I really thought I would be returning it. I WON'T BE. I live in rural Alaska and have a large driveway area which is always covered with leaves, now it isn't 1st time in almost 20 years! This thing is a POWERHOUSE! My only complaint is that it doesn't come with some sort of strap or harness, I will figure something out, because it does get heavy and the only way to use it is with one or the other hands. GREAT PRODUCT FOR UNDER $100!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Better than i expected
customer_reviews.text: This blower has as much power as any hand held gas blower if had. The air inlet being on the back, rather than the side, allows you to switch hands without your pants getting sucked in. On low speed it blows debris out of the decorative rocks, gently rolling them a bit, but not too much. On high it is very powerful. If you can get to a power and cord, there is no reason to use gas again. And, no battery charging. I would strongly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Omni

customer_reviews.title: Poor attachment fit with tube connections !
customer_reviews.text: Tube extensions will not lock into place! On blower, the fit is way to tight! So as I kept blowing leaves, the two black extension tubes kept falling off of blower! Poor design! Way to tight! Also, blower rear end kept sucking up into my jacket! It was a constant fight! Unit has great blowing power, but to cumbersome! I'm a Man, and I had to struggle with it! Great price and very good blow ing power. Wear ear protection, this unit is very loud! Andrew L
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L. Fraser

customer_reviews.title: 1st time blower owner
customer_reviews.text: Living in AZ I have to say using a blower the first time I was impressed. I am not into all special options or additions. In AZ you have the gravel yards and I only needed to use the halfway strength setting to blow leaves and hedge clippings. Full strength actually blew the gravel around (to give an idea of the strength). Noise wise it did not bother me because I use Bluetooth headphones with noise cancelling and music while I am doing yard work. For the price I am quite happy with it. If you do a lot of yard work, I suggest you get the extended warranty at such an acceptable price.
customer_reviews.author: Misudfr

customer_reviews.title: Most powerful blower for the money
customer_reviews.text: Looked long and hard for a plug in blower before choosing this one. We have 2 Worx battery blowers that use the same battery as our other Worx tools. They are great for decks and steps but for a long driveway with leaf piles 3-4 feet high we needed more power. We like our Worx tools for innovation so gave it a try. This thing is hugely powerful and cleared everyting very fast. I bought longer 12 amp extention cords and out them on a reel so I never have to stop. I highly recommend if you have lots of leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Kuala

customer_reviews.title: Don't mess with batteries............
customer_reviews.text: Yep, tried another brand's battery operated leaf blower. Not enough power, battery lasted 20 minutes. Not good enough for leaves from 4 cherry, one plumb and a birch tree. So happy with the Worx WG520, full power will knock both your socks off, nice to have the variable speed. This little machine makes leaf blowing a pleasure. I kid you not!!!!
customer_reviews.author: seashells

customer_reviews.title: Mother of all Blowers !!
customer_reviews.text: This blower is the best one I have ever used and I have been using one since the '80's so I have experience with them. The variable speed is awesome for doing different areas that need different amount of air blowing. The volume of air this thing puts out is awesome at high speed - way stronger than any gas powered blower I have used. And it is not loud at all- that is a great feature of it also. They did a nice job of keeping it balanced- better than any other I have used and the cord holding clip works very well at keeping the extension cord connected. this is a fantastic blower !!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Worx. The name says it all. What a beast.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed by the power of this unit. I have a lot of palm tree and organic debris to clear from under stones/gravel. I was concerned the outlet design wouldn't work for me but this thing has the power to not only shift the stones and clear the organics but also clear all the stones if I turn it up a bit. It's produces some serious airflow while being light and comfortable to operate. I'm 100% happy I chose this over competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: WORX Made a Good One
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned a Greenworks blower, also a verified purchase from Amazon. That little guy worked great for about 2 months, and then it took a nap and would never wake up. Eventually, I decided to purchase this Worx Blower and it's a monster. It gets every job done, no matter what I throw at it. Leaves, mulch, grass clippings, rocks, dirt, etc. Well, I came home one day and found that it had eaten my Greenworks blower and all that was left was the extension cord. Moral of the story is; choose wisely. Choose Worx.
customer_reviews.author: Brad the Tech Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Light and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge step up from my "heavy" 30 year old leaf blower. It is very light weight with a handle that is very ergonomic in helping to point it correctly without muscling it around. The on/off and power level switch is right where your thumb naturally rests on the handle. Looking at the wide nozzle I was a bit worried that it might not have good power, but not to worry about that. It blew 4" diameter river rocks around in my Arizona rock landscaped yard when I was trying to dislodge leaves caught in the rocks. Great buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: M Dean

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic electric blower
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic electric blower. This thing is almost as powerful as a full backpack gas blower. My arm will actually get sore from this thing trying to take off like a jet engine at full power. Simple, easy to use, very powerful, and cheap. What more could you ask for. If you can use a drop-cord and don't have a few acres to do, this is perfect. If you have to use this more than 15 minutes continuously, then you might thing about a gas backpack blower...because your arm will eventually get tire holding this. Otherwise, for 1 acre properties or less, or drying your car, etc. this is just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Darin H

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 hours
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful, but I have about 2 hours of light use on mine over several months (I use it to blow out my garage and clean a few walkways) and it just died. No warnings, no funny noises. Just stopped working. Other than that its great! Useless and non-functioning, but it is nice and new looking unlike the 20 year old black and decker that I replaced with this defective tool.
customer_reviews.author: Sean G

customer_reviews.title: This product blows
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good blower for yardwork. This one has far exceeded my expectations. It is like having a mini jet engine to blast grass cutting, liquid amber balls, leaves, dirt, and whatever else I want to blow away. It is simple to assemble, and the variable speed blower control is quite helpful. Unlike gas blowers, the sound is not that loud in comparison. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants an electric blower.
customer_reviews.author: a customer

customer_reviews.title: Worx blower 11 amp
customer_reviews.text: This blower is awesome The only thing I don't understand is why they offer you a 16/3 100 ' cord that's only rated for 7 amp.... When the worx blower clearly states that it's an 11 amp Blower to get the longest life out of this blower I would recommend a 14/3 100' Cord that is rated at 15 amp It may cost 20 dollars more but well worth it... this way you don't worry about burning up the motor on the blower or blowing a breaker and have to reset it...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Drying your Car!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to assist in drying my car after a good washing. It works wonders and saves me a lot of time on drying. This is a very powerful blower and I got some additional use out of it by blowing my garage and patio!! Keep in mind that when using this as a car dryer its not going to completely dry your car, only assist in the process, you will need to go over it with a nice microfiber towel to complete the job. If your looking for a blower to evaporate water, look at the Master Blaster Car Dryer, its $400 dollars and not sure its worth all that extra cheddar.
customer_reviews.author: TheManSquatch21

customer_reviews.title: This is the best electric blower I have owned!
customer_reviews.text: I have had several blowers over many years and this is the strongest and most capable of all of them. It has a big chute and blows leaves, dirt, and small objects effectively. I often use it instead of my wheeled gas powered blower; it is nearly as effective and much more maneuverable. I use it about once weekly and have had it for 3 years; so far there have been no issues with the motor or blower assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Died after a year
customer_reviews.text: I was blowing leaves this past October and it started smoking and then made a horrible noise and then completely shut down. Should not happen after only a year. We only used it in the Fall of 2017 and then the beginning of Fall, 2018. Never buying this product/make again.
customer_reviews.author: Doreen

customer_reviews.title: Very Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 Toro leaf blowers in the past and they lasted about 3 years and not very powerful to push large amount of leaves. My Toro died and I purchased the WORX WG520 This model seems to be much more powerful than the Toro that has more MPH. More important is the cfm speed on these leaf blowers. the WORX has up to 600 cfm. This is more than the Toro. I was amazed how much power it had with blowing leaves this morning.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Just OK - Sucks in your shirt
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning this because I got tired of the rear air intake sucking my shirt into it. It has adequate power but come this fall, I don't think it have the power to move a lot of elm tree leaves on my back yard lawn. Good power for hard surfaces, it is light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Staeb

customer_reviews.title: A very effective blower!
customer_reviews.text: After using this blower for a couple months, I completely agree with other reviewers that said cubic feet per minute is a better measure of blower effectiveness than miles per hour air speed. This blower is considerably more effective for moving leaves than the Toro I had previously. The only reason I did not rate it a 5 was because it is relatively heavy and because of the design which pulls air in from the rear which gives it a strong tendency to suck your shirt, jacket, trousers, etc. over the intake. Wearing tight fitting clothing helps. It seems like a well built, sturdy blower which I hope serves me for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first, but within a couple of months it became finicky and would only work sometimes. Thought it was an issue with the outlet, or cord, but after changing both it still would only work occasionally. It is now 8 months after purchase and it hasn't started for 2 months. I feel like there is an issue with the switch (trigger).
customer_reviews.author: Kerri A.

customer_reviews.title: Price and Performance are spot on!
customer_reviews.text: Ideally, a battery powered leak blower was my target. Wasn't able to find a battery powered leaf blower that had any significant run time or battery longevity like my string/weed trimmer. And battery replacement is expensive. Not wishing to rake or sweep till the cows come home, Plan B: a corded leaf blower. Upon many reviews, I pulled the trigger on the Worx Turbine blower. Bottom line: a winner! Do I wish I didn't have to drag an electric cord: yes, but not a deal breaker. And most important, no battery worries and the power (adjustable!) is really quite impressive. Price? very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Sandman

customer_reviews.title: Light, Simple, Effective
customer_reviews.text: I use this after every mow day. I looove it! I find it fairly lightweight and way more powerful than I was expecting. I blew a bunch of leaves across my yard taking the long way. It took awhile but I was also trying to be perfect. I can't wait for fall! I use it to clean off my driveway, two story deck, and walkways around the house. I haven't had any problems with it. I use it about once a week, sometimes more. Probably 20-30 minutes at a time. When I did the leaves, it took more than an hour. There were a ton leaves. I couldn't recommend it highly enough. I'm "blown" away by this piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: ME Sags

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! So very powerful. Just went across my whole yard in maybe 8-10 mins with tons of fallen leaves and dead dry grass/weeds. What I needed for sure. So powerful on ful mode it almost makes your arms move with it. Crazy powerful. Highly recommend! I’m 53 and semifit. My thought is that the Elderly or weak person might not be able to handle the power on full mode. Gave my arms a workout for sure but i have a large area and put on full blast.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: It'll blow your wig back!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super powerful, I have three bushes in the front yard that have pink flowers that shed a lot. Everytime we get wind they end up on the patio. I blew these out and bagged them up. I also cleared out all the dirt that piled up on the back patio. It's so much easier that using a push broom for a large area, and it's less wasteful than trying to use a sprayer on the hose. It's very powerful so get everything out of the way or you might lose it in the neighbors yard.
customer_reviews.author: whatwhat

customer_reviews.title: Nice blower, easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually buy outdoor tools that have to be plugged in, but the area I want to use this for was within a cord's length. I get tired of maintaining all the gas-powered equipment and this pretty much requires none. Easy to put together right out of the box. I had to adjust the prongs of the cord so that it would stay plugged into my extension cord's plug, but after that, it worked without a hitch. Good blower capacity, not as powerful as others seemed to think, but definitely enough for most any use.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: It is wonderful
customer_reviews.text: We live in the woods so it rains pine needles cones small branches all the time I built a very big padio and a big deck cleaning it was a pain and took way too long only to have to do it over the next day. I was a jet Mech in the air force I always though it would be nice to have that kind of power to clean the yard. Well now I do it is wonderful to clean the hole place in ten minutes it can blow needles 15 feet away. I going to put a shoulder strap on it. This has a power adjustment for small people.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Butterfield

customer_reviews.title: Seriously awesome
customer_reviews.text: I recently sold my 3-in-1 blower/weed eater/edger and purchased this as I only really needed a blower for the garage and driveway. Wanted electric so I don’t have to deal with gas and fumes in the garage. Didn’t want a battery powered unit that’ll drain dead in only a few minutes. This thing does not disappoint! Much stronger than my old gas blower. Kick up endless mini-tornadoes with this. Seriously, look no further if you’re looking for an electric blower. An additional positive, is that this comes with a small pre-formed hook in the back so that it can be stored on the wall by a single screw or nail. Great addition for an organized garage!
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Great blower, better value!
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a lot of blowers before making this purchase and am very happy with my choice! While I would have liked a cordless blower, I do enjoy the fact that every time I plug this in, it works. I'll never have to worry about a battery being charged, running out, or dying. On the power side of things, this blower really blows! It is light and well balanced and does a great job. I really can't point out a single issue with this blower. If you're looking for a powerful, dependable blower at a great value, you can't go wrong here!
customer_reviews.author: J. Carney

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this POS
customer_reviews.text: I really regret buying this thing. The blower motor doesn't stay constant at one speed and fluctuates, which is annoying. After only 10 or so uses, my extension cord got stuck to the prongs in the unit. It took two strong people to separate them. I thought everything was straightened out, but now the cord is stick again. The cords plays well with other devices, so it's the blower that has an issue. If I could return this item I would. I now need to write off my purchase and buy a better quality blower. It certainly won't be a WORX. What a POS.
customer_reviews.author: spiritualufo

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, easy to use, cord can be cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: I just used it and this thing is powerful, super easy to use, and quieter than I had expected. It's light enough to hold although I can imagine a backpack version would be even nicer for big jobs. My only complaint is cord management - the cord kept getting pulled out despite using the little plastic connector that is supposed to help prevent that. I had considered a cordless blower but I got the sense that (a) the battery wouldn't last as long and (b) the blower wouldn't be as powerful. In ay case, I'm sure I'll figure out how to resolve the cord issue over time. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Guttman

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Blower I Use Often
customer_reviews.text: I use this blower to clean dirt, leaves, and debris from my outdoor decks and from areas covered with cement. It has 2 speeds. The lowest speed is usable in most situations. The high speed I think is even more powerful than my commercial gas blower. My only dislike is that the extension cord you will use is only compatible with a two-hole cord and most of my cords have 3. An adapter may solve this issue. If an adapter was included I would give 5 stars. Be careful not to hold next to your stomach as air is drawn in through the back of the blower.
customer_reviews.author: txusa

customer_reviews.title: Piles leaves higher before loosing oomph
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to compare leaf blowers across the states, as the leaves and moisture content is different. The only measure I can use is 'how deep a pile can the blower create before i have to get out the rake.' The last blower would make a pile below my knees...the worxs made a pile well above my knees. Another feature is how well the blower basts out wet leaves pastes to the soil, which kills the grass over the winter. The worx blasts out plastered leaves very well. The balance of the machine is such that the rotational force seems less...and less pain in the wrists and elbows after long use.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: I JUST TRIED MINE OUT.  FANTASTIC PERFORMANCE!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is truly powerful, one of the strongest non-backpack leaf blower available. Any more thrust and it would be unmanageable. The only thing it lacks is some sort of harness or a second hand grip to keep it from blowing itself, and my arm, backwards. I can feel an invention coming on. IF IT WEREN'T CORDED, IT COULD PROPEL A SMALL SCOOTER!﻿
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning the sidewalks and garage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these for work over a year ago to clean the sidewalks off outside of the office. I was so impressed that I purchased one for my home now. No more sweeping the garage or driveway, just plug it in and in just a couple minutes I'm now done. Great power, and the on off is a progressive dial so you can adjust the speed and power as you go simply and easily.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Powerful leaf blower!!!
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight leaf blower has LOTS of power!!! We have a very big yard with lots of maple trees. The leave in the fall are endless! My husband has always hand raked since we purchased this house 20yrs ago. I read reviews and did some investigating on battery, electric, and gas’s powered leaf blowers. I’m so glad I chose this one and so is my husband!! This one has LOTS of power! He’s so impressed with both me and this leaf blower :)
customer_reviews.author: M.D.

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it for a couple of days. I'll say up front that returning it in the box it came in is impossible because it doesn't come apart. But at this price who cares? I LOVE the adjustable speed. Oddly low is what makes it outstanding. Now I can control where leaves go much better without getting dirt in my face/hair like my last one. The only thing that I would change (on this & other machines) is to have a spout that can go on level with the ground. Tall people tend to have to blow down rather than along the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two in a row DOA
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one blower, it was a dud. I know this happens, so I returned it, and got another. This one was also dead. Quality control on this is terrible. Do not order this unless you are okay waiting for replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast
customer_reviews.text: It really works well as both a leaf blower and dryer. Very powerful and also adjustable (for power). Although its not heavy, it can get a little fatiguing on the hand after using it a while - but that's a minor thing for me. Its a lot easier to use this electric blower than many of the gas-powered versions, even on fairly large areas. It doesn't lack any blowing power whatsoever and is easily equal to any gas-powered variant.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D

customer_reviews.title: Relatively quite and clean
customer_reviews.text: I have no experience using gasoline powered blowers, but I can tell you that this one is far quieter than my neighbors (not totally quiet, by any means, but a lot quieter) and seems to be very powerful. Note that it comes with a very short cord, so you'll need to buy and extra long outdoor extension cord to use it with any ease. It has a regular plug (2-prong, not a 3 prong) for when you are buying the extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: Score623

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: This mini jet engine was exactly what I was looking for! Moves leaves with ease. Have to concentrate alittle more on the wet/heavy oak leaves that are stuck in the mud but that is to be expected. Noise isn't too bad on high and the thing is pretty lightweight for the power you get. Highly recommend if you need to push a lot of leaves and don't want to spend countless hours using a rake.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great blower
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this several times since purchasing and it works great. It doesn’t seem to move air quite as fast as previous blowers I’ve owned, but it moves so much more air and affects such a wider area at once, it actually makes jobs take less time. I’m mainly using it for a few leaves and grass clippings on the sidewalk and driveway. Seems very well made and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: get with the 21st century
customer_reviews.text: I dont know... best gardening tool ever?!!!!!!!!! Hey, have you ever found yourself sweeping up leaves and and there are some darn leaves that are bunching up in plain sight but you just cant get at them with out moving a bunch of stuff? Well get the Worx Turbine TURBO AWESOMENESS!!!!!!!!!!!! and never let those leave bother you again. I had leaves and dog fur behind a drain pipe for years but this thing just vaporized them!!!! I dont know where they went but they aren't behind the pipe any more and really isnt that what its all about, Peace of Mind?
customer_reviews.author: 7Cs

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Value
customer_reviews.text: I read very positive reviews on this leaf blower and was not happy with the gas one I had been using. I'm very happy I paid attention to the reviews and bought this electric one. I it easy to handle, does not overheat, you can control the force and direction very easily. It works quite a bit better than my old gas one (I'm toward the end of my second season using this one) and was less expensive. I recommend it without any reservations.
customer_reviews.author: John Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Blows like a champ
customer_reviews.text: This thing BLOWS (in a good way). If you want a cheap way to blow off concrete and don't have to go very far with it then this thing is for you. I don't have much driveway so having a corded blower isn't an issue. I will say, this thing is loud in a ear damaging way so please wear hearing protection when using it. It isn't heavy at all and blows better than most crappy gas powered blowers excluding the big backpack blowers.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron C

customer_reviews.title: no customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to buy a longer extension cord, but even my Wife can use this. It is light compared to other ones. I will eventually need a shoulder strap to use for longer times, but for now it works great. I called customer service and got many recordings selling unwanted stuff. I never was able to get to customer service. Terrible customer service!!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful for drying vehicles.
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic. I use it only for touch less drying of our cars, so I have no idea how effective it is for garden use, or how it compares to its competitors in that regard. My only reason for 4 stars is the pigtail electrical cable is very short and falls loose off the extension cable. I wish that was better designed and included a tether to hold it more securely in place.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best leaf blower I've ever purchased. This unit puts out an unbelievable amount of airflow. Now I know what the CFM rating is all about. Don't be fooled by the size of the outlet. It probably needs the size to accommodate the airflow. It is a big unit but is quite balanced when holding. This will blow a debris pile 3 feet high about 10 feet forward. No more matted leaves. The information stated that it has a two speed switch but it is actually variable with the ability to power way down if needed. Unbelievable. Way to go Worx!
customer_reviews.author: J. Looper

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this blower. It's very easy to use. It's lightweight. Easy to put together right out of the box. Pretty powerful for an electric blower. Blows everything from leaves twigs etc. I've always bought WorkX products. They have always been a good product. I highly recommend this blower.
customer_reviews.author: dana

product_meta.title: WORX WG520 Turbine 600 Corded Electric Leaf Blower, Black
product_meta.description: Style:Corded Turbine BlowerKey features the turbine 600 electric leaf blower with patented jet engine technology delivers extreme blowing force. Light enough for one-handed operation, The turbine 600 features air speeds to 110 mph with a CFM of 600 & a hyper-stream air nozzle for extra tough conditions. The fastest way to clear your yd. This season! Powerful turbine fan technology the Word family of turbine blowers takes leaf blowing to a new level. The all-new turbine technology delivers forceful, high-capacity air volume to do everything from sweep the driveway & Sidewalk after mowing, to piling up those Leaves on a fall afternoon. The turbine blowers are lightweight, ergonomic & powerful. With three different Power options, you can choose which one is right for you & your home. In addition to the variable-speed control, the 12 amp turbine 600 leaf blower features a hyper-stream air nozzle for extra tough conditions. Tackle leaves & debris around your yd. & home quickly & with ease.
feature_bullets: Turbine fan tech: Worx engineers figured out how to get a jet engine type motor inside of a leaf blower; Cool, huh, Super powerful, yet not so loud that you’ll think it’s getting ready for takeoff
2 speeds for different jobs: It’s actually better to go slow for pavement or tight corners; But on the open lawn, switch to speed 2, and its 110 mph, and let’s see what the Turbine can do

600 CFM: We named the turbine 600 after the 600 cubic feet per minute of high capacity air volume that shoots out of its wide mouth nozzle; That’s a wide, strong path of air that allows you to clear large areas with fewer passes

Hyperstream air nozzle: But we didn’t just stop designing once we were finished with the TURBINE engine; We added an attachable nozzle, optimized to direct all that volume in a concentrated area for tougher jobs

One-handed operation: With all that power, believe it or not, the turbine 600 is designed to be controlled with just one hand; It’s only 6.4 pounds, and the ergonomic design funnels all that wind in a way that’s easy to handle
Extension cord retainer: The electrical cord comes with a retainer attached, so when using an extension cord, it won’t disconnect, even when it gets snagged

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars4,242 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
